entry.title: Agave Americana 4''
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 9.99

There are over 200 species of Agave found across the Americas. These plants can grow to huge sizes in their natural habitats, living for many decades and flowering only once before dying. But as they grow fairly slowly, they make perfectly sized indoor plants. Agave prefer hot, dry conditions with very little water or care needed. 

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 Full sun
 Water when soil is completely dry
 Rarely
 Toxic to animals
 Growth : Rosette, up to 2 ft
 Origin : Central, South America
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Aeonium "Mint Saucer" 4"
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 12.95

Aeonium are peculiar plants that grow colourful rosettes at the end of long, bare stems. These plants are winter growers, needing slightly more water during this period of the year. Aeonium go dormant in the summer, but should not be left to dry out completely like a cactus or succulent.
  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Our plants are shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
 A few hours of direct sunlight
 Water moderately when 1-2 inches of soil are dry
 Rarely
Non-toxic to animals
 Growth : Rosette, 1-3 feet
 Origin : Canary Islands
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Calathea Makoyana
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en Ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 17.99

The Calathea Makoyana is a beautifully patterned plant. It is also called Peacock Plant or Cathedral Windows for a good reason! This plant is a favourite around the world as a house plant mainly due to its beautiful foliage and bold markings.

  • Shape and size may vary from photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots

 Shade with indirect light
 Water when the top inch has completely dried out
 Small white flowers
 Non-toxic to animals
 Growth : Up to 60cm
 Origin : Brazil

entry.title: Sansevieria Mikado Fernwood 2.5"
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 8.99

Sansevieria Mikado Fernwood is a small snake plant with long, elongated and pointed leaves that slightly arch outward. The hardy leaves can tolerate harsh conditions and can bear any intensity of light exposure. Such an elegant plant that has air-purifying quality can be added to every bedroom and office for fresh vibes.

entry.title: Chain of Spades
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 9.99 - 16.99 (2 variants)

Chain of Spades is a quick growing succulent with long, thin vines and beautiful spade shaped leaves.

It is easy to cut back the stems of this plant in order to keep it looking full and tidy. Simply cut off a part of the stem with a few leaf nodes, remove the bottom leaves, and plant it back in the top of the pot!

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 2.5" or 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 Bright indirect light, up to a few hours of direct sun
 Water thoroughly when soil is completely dry
 Pink pitcher-like flowers
 Non-toxic to animals
 Growth : Trailing, several feet in length
 Origin : South Africa
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Euphorbia Evansii 4"
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en Ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 10.99

Euphorbia evansii can grow to become a large tree in the northeastern provinces of South Africa. With time, this species forms a single-stemmed tree in pots if the lower branches are trimmed flush with the trunk. The branches are thin, spiny.

As with many other Euphorbia species, the latex from the plant is poisonous and can cause skin irritations. Despite it's thorny protection, it is best to keep it out of reach of animals! 

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
 Full sun
 Water when the soil is completely dry
 Rarely
 Toxic to animals
 Growth: Upright, up to 6 ft
 Origin : South Africa
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Haworthia Limifolia 2.5"
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 4.99

Haworthia are small, rosette succulents that are very resistant and easy to care for. They occasionally grow as solitary plants, but will more often grow offsets that can be removed and shared with friends! Haworthia limifolia is known for the unique, geometric ridges along its leaves. Also known as ‘Fairy Washboard’, it is quite beautiful when it is well-taken care of!

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Our plants are shipped in a 2.5" pot to prevent damage to the roots
 Low light to a few hours of direct sun
 Water thoroughly when soil is completely dry
 Small flowers atop a long stem
 Non-toxic to animals
 Growth: Rosette, 3-5 inches
 Origin : South Africa
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Sansevieria 4''
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 9.99

Sansevieria, also known as snake plants, are among the most popular and robust of house plants. They are especially sought after for their air purifying qualities.

Sansevieria can tolerate extremely dry temperatures and a variety from lighting conditions from quite bright to very low light. They are slow growing and sculptural, making perfect office plants.

entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 15.99

Tillandsia cyanea is also known as Pink Quill for the impressive flowering bract growing out of the top of the plant. This part of the plant is not the actual flower and small purple flowers will grow out from its sides. This plant appreciates a humid environment, but does well in many conditions.

Ceropegia woodii variegata, also known as String of Hearts, is a quick growing succulent with long, thin vines and beautiful heart shaped leaves. The variegated variety of this plant with show beautiful white and pink leaves when given the right amount of sunlight.

It is easy to cut back the stems of this plant in order to keep it looking full and tidy. Simply cut off a part of the stem with a few leaf nodes, remove the bottom leaves, and plant it back in the top of the pot!

entry.title: Lithops 2.5''
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 14.99

Lithops are also known as Living Stone Plants. They grow in rocky areas and camouflage themselves to avoid being eaten by grazing animals. They are desert plants accustomed to blazing sun and extremely dry climates.

The care for these plants is quite particular - they are dormant in both summer and winter. They will require watering only once or twice in the fall and again in the spring. Make sure the soil is completely dry before watering.  

    • Shape and size may vary from the photo
    • Shipped in a 2.5" pot to prevent damage to the roots
    • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 Full sun
 Water 1-2 times in Spring and Fall
 White or yellow flowers
 Non-toxic to animals
 Growth: Clumping, 1-2 inches
 Origin : Namibia, South Africa
 Grown in Canada

Gasteria maculata is a succulent plant also known as Ox Tongue Plant. It is a slow growing and compact plant that is very low maintenance. It has sharp, triangular leaves, with white, spotted variegation. The tiny spots on the leaves are arranged in bands, giving the leaves faint stripes.

entry.title: Yellow Moon Cactus
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 9.99 - 18.99 (2 variants)

The Moon Cactus is actually made of two different species grafted together. The colourful cactus, a Gymnocalycium, doesn't have any chlorophyll so it needs the help of the support cactus, a Hylocereus, to survive.

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Shipped in a 2.5" or 3.5" pot to prevent damage to the roots

 Non-toxic to animals

 Origin : South America
 Grown in Canada

entry.title: Aloe Arborescens 4''
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cactus en ligne
Type: Plant
Price: 9.99

There are over 500 different species of Aloe found across Africa. Aloe Arborescens is also known as "Torch Aloe" for its bright red flowers. These succulents make great houseplants as they are quite forgiving and easy to care for.

Aloe can endure many different light conditions and can survive very long periods without water. Make sure to allow the soil to dry completely, and give your aloe a heavy watering when the bottom leaves start to feel less plump.

Although many aloe plants can be very large in their natural habitat, they stay much smaller in indoor conditions.

  • Shape and size may vary from the photo
  • Our plants are shipped in a 4" pot to prevent damage to the roots
  • Free delivery across Canada with a minimum purchase of $95
 Bright indirect light to full sun
 Water thoroughly when soil is completely dry
 Many red flowers atop a tall stem
 Mildly toxic to animals
 Growth : Rosette, up to 2m
 Origin : South Africa
 Grown in Canada
